intro: Micromeles thibetica, commonly known as the Tibetan starfruit, is a species of flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, star-shaped fruits that resemble those of the genus Cydon. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous terrain, thriving in cool and moist conditions. Its leaves are usually elliptical and have a glossy surface, while its flowers are fragrant and white or pale pink in color. Micromeles thibetica is valued for its ornamental appeal and is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
